articles.author: Claire Thornton, USA TODAY
articles.title: 3.5 million cancer deaths prevented in recent decades, but disparities are 'alarming,' report says - USA TODAY
articles.description: The American Cancer Society says pandemic-related impacts to cancer detection and treatment aren't yet known.
articles.content:
A new report says 3.5 million cancer deaths have been prevented in recent decades, thanks to declines in smoking, advances in treatments and improved early detection.
But the cancer statistics paper… [+4596 chars]

articles.author: Scott Wooldridge
articles.title: Cost of premiums, deductibles are an increasing burden on working Americans - BenefitsPro
articles.description: In 2020, health insurance premiums and deductibles ate up 11.6% of Americans' incomes.
articles.content:
Spending per person in employer plans grew by nearly 22% over the period 2015 to 2019, outpacing both inflation and economic growth.
